place.name: CAVERS
place.gazetteerText: Cavers, par., S. Roxburghshire, 2 miles NE. of Hawick, 18,254 ac., pop. 1318; contains Cavers House, an old seat of the Douglases. John Leyden, the scholar-poet (1775-1811), was a native. (In 1887, John Bartholomew's Gazetteer of the British Isles)
